p: For example, it is hypothesized that the following diseases originated from either domestic and wild animals: smallpox from rodents more than 10,000 ya., common cold rhinovirus from cattle more than 4,000 ya., influenza from pigs more than 8,000 ya., measles from cattle plague 300 ya., HIV from non-human primates (NHP) less than 100 ya. (Hughes 2010).
